newsitem.title: USA: Ziff-Davis launches PC Week China.
newsitem.headline: Ziff-Davis launches PC Week China.

text.p: Ziff-Davis International Media Group, a leading publisher of computer magazines, said Friday it has launched PC Week China, its third publication in China.

The weekly trade publication will be sent free to volume buyers of computer products for organisations. It will be the first publication to use a controlled circulation strategy and the first to be published in full colour in China, Ziff-Davis said.
Ziff-Davis is owned by Softbank Corp of Japan.
PC Week China is the third Ziff-Davis title to be launched in the Chinese market after PC Magazine China and PC Computing China, the company said.
PC Week China will be published under license from Ziff-Davis Richina Media LDC to the Chinese Institute of Electronics. The first issue will make its debut Sept. 23, with a circulation of 60,000.
